Is Kingdom of Heaven anti-Christian, pro-Muslim?
 
 Check out this review:
 
 http://www.jewishworldreview.com/0505/kingdom_of_heaven.php3

No, it isn't. 
 
 Really, it's meant for entertainment, and it just so happened to actually portray the Christians as violent, because, as history will tell us, thats what they were. At least the Knights Templar. You will see that the movie actually has a very positive view of non-Templar christians, along with actually showing the Muslim forces as people, not as blood thirsty barbarians.

well, from the trailers i've seen, particularly the pre-battle one where elf-boy paris talks to the crowd, he goes off about how the city is just stones and defending the religious sites isn't the point as well as neither the invading muslims or defending christians have any real link to the fundemental reason for the war.

Main reason for the apparent 'pro-muslim' side of things is that Saladin was very gracious and honerable to his enemies, the europeans who wrote the history books we are familar with. To his own people he was apparently quite ruthless and vicious at times
